intro: Malus zhaojiaoensis, commonly known as the Zhaojiao apple, is a rare species of flowering plant in the Rosaceae family. It is native to China and is characterized by its ornamental flowers and small, edible fruits. The plant typically grows as a deciduous tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are ovate with serrated edges, and it produces white to pinkish flowers in the spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable species for botanical research and conservation efforts.
